name: Visual Effects Assessment
description: Evaluation criteria for visual effects, including animation .
author: the-zinny team

attributes.name: Artistry
attributes.description: The artistic quality, creativity, or aesthetic integration of visuals.

attributes.name: Technical Achievement
attributes.description: The innovation and use of new or improved technology.

attributes.name: Production Achievement
attributes.description: The improvement of support tools and processes, exceptional management of process, or groundbreaking scale of scope.

attributes.name: Application Skill
attributes.description: The skill level in applying VFX techniques effectively.

attributes.name: Overall Fidelity
attributes.description: The overall realism and believability of the VFX.

attributes.name: Worst Case Fidelity
attributes.description: The quality of the least convincing VFX scenes.

keyframes.10: No shots were out of place

attributes.name: Necessity of VFX
attributes.description: The importance of visual effects in conveying the story, or overall success.

attributes.name: Contribution to Narrative
attributes.description: The overall contribution of VFX to the film's narrative.

attributes.name: Supporting Role
attributes.description: How well the VFX supports and enhances the plot.

attributes.name: Community Value
attributes.description: The value of the VFX work within the VFX community.

attributes.name: Humanity Value
attributes.description: The moral or societal value of the film.
